channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syria Live Updates: Rebels Declare Damascus Free of al-Assad
item.description: After just a few days of rapid advances, the rebels appeared to control Syria’s capital. They said they would work with a top official in President Ba...

item.title: New US weapons package for Ukraine brings total in the past week to $1.7 billion — ‘The baton will soon be passed’
item.description: “Others will decide the course ahead. And I hope that they will build on the strength that we have forged over the past four years.”

item.title: Syrians Mourn All They Have Lost, Even as They Celebrate
item.description: Thoughts of loved ones dead or missing complicate joyous relief at the prospect of an end to the rule of Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: How Peter Thiel’s network of right-wing techies is infiltrating Donald Trump’s White House
item.description: With David Sacks as “AI and Crypto Czar” and Elon Musk as co-head of DOGE, Thiel’s network has become closely tied to the new Trump administration.

item.title: She Sued Over Transgender ‘Conversion Therapy,’ a First for China
item.description: Ling’er won a settlement payout from the hospital where she was held for three months against her will and subjected to electroshock therapy.

item.title: The CEO of a state-run Russian banking giant admits the economy shows major signs of slowing
item.description: "We are now seeing significant signals of economic slowdown, particularly in housing construction and investment."

item.title: Syrians Mourn All They Have Lost, Even as They Celebrate
item.description: Thoughts of loved ones dead or missing complicate joyous relief at the prospect of an end to the rule of Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Which Marco Rubio Will Serve President Trump?
item.description: Rubio, the choice for secretary of state, has evolved from a hawkish optimist to a more inward-looking, antiglobalist pessimist.

item.title: Miho Nakayama, Japanese Music and Movie Star, Dies at 54
item.description: A top-selling pop singer as a teenager in the 1980s, she also had an award-winning career as a dramatic actress.

item.title: The gun that killed UnitedHealthcare’s CEO may have been a ‘very unique weapon’
item.description: Police are looking into the possibility that the shooter used a veterinary pistol, NYPD Chief of Detectives Joseph Kenny told reporters on Friday.

item.title: Syria Civil War: What to Know About the Conflict and the Rebel Groups
item.description: Advances by a coalition of opposition groups have abruptly transformed the landscape of Syria’s civil war. Here’s a closer look at where things stand.

item.title: France Unveils a Renovated Notre-Dame, 5 Years After a Ruinous Fire
item.description: A centuries-old bell rang and an archbishop knocked at the Gothic cathedral’s great doors, which reopened for a V.I.P. ceremony after its monumental r...

item.title: Syria’s Assad is under siege and is making overtures to US
item.description: Assad is ordering his army to fall back to defend Damascus, essentially ceding much of the country to insurgents.

item.title: She Sued Over Transgender ‘Conversion Therapy,’ a First for China
item.description: Ling’er won a settlement payout from the hospital where she was held for three months against her will and subjected to electroshock therapy.

item.title: South Korea’s Ex-Defense Chief Is Detained Over Martial Law Episode
item.description: Prosecutors are investigating whether President Yoon Suk Yeol and his followers committed insurrection when they briefly put South Korea under martial...
